title: If it were SOMEHOW possible to move faster than light, could one escape the event horizon of a black hole? - Quora

response.answer_text: According to BH theorists, strange things are afoot in and around "black holes": One strangeness has it that "inside" a BH event horizon, all geodesics (all directions) lead to the BH core (I refuse to use the "singularity" abomination), so it appears as if a BH "jailbreak" would be impossible, at any speed. See Properties of Black Holes.

First of all you don't want to escape a black hole because is a doorway to enter the fifth dimension. Once you encounter one you have no choice but to go thru it. Just make sure you are engulfed in a very strong magnetic field to survive the journey thru this fifth dimension. UFOs make artificial black holes and travel through them all the time.
